thread.title: Harry Hall becomes Northwestern's all-time leading rusher in win over Salisbury
thread.title_full: Harry Hall becomes Northwestern's all-time leading rusher in win over Salisbury

title: Harry Hall becomes Northwestern's all-time leading rusher in win over Salisbury
text:
Complete Box Score Â» 
Northwestern senior running back Harry Hall racked up 192 yards and two touchdowns to lead the Tigers to a 30-21 homecoming victory over Salisbury on Friday night. 
In the win, Hall became the Tigers' all-time leading rusher. The record was previously held by Northwestern legend and former Lehigh University standout Brett Snyder, the brother of Tigers coach Josh Snyder. Hall is two touchdowns away from the school's all-time touchdown record held by Brett Snyder. 
Hall had a 73-yard touchdown run in the second quarter to put the Tigers on the scoreboard and a 1-yard run to cap the scoring in the fourth quarter. 
Dylan Snyder passed for 146 yards, including a 77-yard score to Trevor Cunningham that put the Tigers ahead in the fourth quarter. Cunningham had 132 yards receiving in the game. 
Brett Schillinger returned a kickoff 85 yards for a touchdown for Northwestern. 
Tevon Weber threw for 253 yards and three touchdowns for the Falcons, including a 50-yard score to Alex Kubinec that gave the Falcons the lead in the fourth quarter. 
Salisbury's Mason Donaldson caught eight passes for 141 yards and a pair of touchdowns. Kubinec finished with 87 receiving yards.
